str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To utter additional threats. From pros and apeileo; to menace additionally.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.

word: They could not find a way
parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To chastise, curtail, punish; mid: I cause to be punished. From kolos; properly, to curtail, i.e. to chastise.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Dative Neuter Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
